title: Can we be honest about matchmaking for a sec?
body:
For the most part its okay... sure you get some outliers... but every so often in silver... even silver I, you get someone who just hit 30, is playing vs mainly unranked or bronze 4-5 in norms, and legitimately has no idea how to play. 

Why is this even a thing? sure people have to start somewhere, and I know the system assumes you are silver to start (which they are gonna fix FINALLY) but why was this ever a possibility?

its the end of the season... teams are pretty even, its a decent game... then i notice we start losing.... then i start to realize our Ekko doing some strange things... then i realize he has 54 cs at 30 minutes, no boots, bought archangel's and ROA and has heal ignite.....

it only takes 1 person to ruin a game sometimes.... it just feels awful knowing Riot values your skill equally to a brand new player... All that hard work and learning and progressing, and Riot just says "this brand new level 30 who has played a single ranked game that he lost in his entire career deserves to be your mid laner in your silver I ranked game."

I kinda expected this climbing through low silver... 5, 4, 3, and even 2 on rare occasion... but man... I just got into silver I, the season is about to end... and this is what I see... We were actually really close to getting a lead, but a ziggs with free cs, freedom to roam, and a competent team makes it really tough to get anything done much less keep your turrets....
